result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J Mills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Must continue to comply with all treatment recommendations of treatment providers and continue with counseling being done, including Gamblers Anonymous. 
Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s). Referral to be made to Barron County Restorative Justice within 30 days.

timeConds.notes: Must meet with Community Service Coordinator no later than Friday, April 24, 2015.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew J Mills

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrew J Mills in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:15  Court relates and gives appearances.
4:17  State makes recommendatoin.
4:20  Court questions defendant.
4:26  Defendant makes statement.

Count #1:  State moves to amend Information to Misdemeanor Theft 943.20(1)(a) and (3)(a) a Class 'A'  Misdemeanor.  Court grants motion.
Defendant pleads guilty to amended charge.  Court finds defendant guilty.

SW
1 year probation
Complete 100 hours of Community Service.  Must meet with Community Service Coordinator no later than Friday, April 24th.
Must participate in a restorative justice program/conference that may include the victim(s).  Referral to be made to BCRJ within 30 days.
Pay court costs
Continue to comply with all treatment recommendation of treatment providers and continue with counseling been done including Gamblers Annonymous.
Any other evaluations/treatment recommended by probation.
(Restitution has been paid in full)

Defendant Andrew J Mills in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Russell Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:57: Investigator Chad Thompson with the Rice Lake Police Dept. called, sworn and direct by State. Witness identifies the Defendant. 12:00: Cross by Defense. Court finds probable cause and binds over for trial. State files Information. Defendant elects to stand mute. Court enters NG plea on Defendant's behalf. Bond continues.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.

  Must have no contact with Market Place Foods in Rice Lake  except for the limited purpose defendants parents may contact Market Place foods.

Defendant Andrew J Mills in court with attorney John Gerard Hinde.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense waives reading of complaint.  Defense waives time limits for preliminary hearing

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 11:30 am.
